intro: Draba oligosperma f. hirtiscapa, commonly known as the hairy-stemmed whitlow grass, is a flowering plant belonging to the Brassicaceae family. It is a low-growing perennial herb characterized by its dense, compact rosette of basal leaves and small, yellowish-white flowers. The plant is native to arctic and alpine regions of Europe and Asia, where it thrives in rocky and sandy soils. Its hairy stems and leaves are adaptations to cold and harsh environmental conditions. The species is often found in open, disturbed habitats such as gravelly slopes and tundra.
